isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 5000, 9000 Series Without Lowered heater Box - REMOVE AND INSTALL - BLEND-AIR UNIT HOUSING ASSEMBLY

note.para: Most components can be serviced without removing the blend-air unit. This procedure should not be performed unless there is definite reason for removing the unit.
A putty-type sealant is used where components pass through the cab floor. Carefully remove this sealant when removing the components. Reseal the components after installation.

step1.para: Turn off engine coolant supply to the heater with the heater hose gate valves in the engine compartment, or clamp off the heater inlet and outlet hoses ( Figure 14) with C-clamps and wood blocks. Be sure not to damage the hoses.
Recover the refrigerant from the Air Conditioning system. Refer to GROUP 16-AIR CONDITIONING THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury from hot coolant, do not remove the heater hoses from the heater core inlet and outlet until the cooling system has cooled down.

step1.para: Note how the heater hoses are connected to the heater core, and label the hoses for proper reconnection later. Remove the heater hoses from the heater core inlet and outlet tubes ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. A/C Heater Unit Connections Under Cab Floor

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. REFRIGERANT LOW PRESSURE SWITCH (R-12 ONLY) BEFORE 1/1/93

note.para: Plug the heater hose inlet and outlet tubes to prevent coolant from being released inside the cab during removal of the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Disconnect the evaporator hoses and fittings ( Figure 14). Cap or plug all hoses and fittings.
Remove the moisture drain nipple and evaporator drain tube, if so equipped, under the cab ( Figure 14).
Remove the sealant from the components that pass through the cab floor.
Remove the unit mounting stud nuts and washers ( Figure 14).
Remove the screws securing the passenger seat and the Blend-Air housing cover plate. Remove the seat and cover from the cab.
Remove the passenger side floor panel, as follows:

step2.para: Remove the scuff plate from door sill.
Remove the screws securing the floor panel.
Take out the floor panel, exposing the air ducts.

step1.para: Remove the sheet metal screws securing the air ducts at the Blend-Air unit.
Disconnect the control cables from inside the Blend-Air unit (at Blend-Air door and thermostatic switch).
Disconnect the electrical wiring. If necessary, remove the passenger side kick panel to gain access.
Carefully lift the Blend-Air unit and remove it from the vehicle.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Position the Blend-Air unit housing assembly in the cab with mounting studs, tubes and pipes protruding through the floor.

step1.para: Install washers and nuts on the mounting studs ( Figure 14). Tighten mounting nuts to 22 to 28 lbf-ft (30 to 38 Nm).

Install the heater hoses on the heater core tubes making certain that the supply hose is on the inlet tube and the return hose on the outlet tube. The heater core inlet tube is the one nearest the center of the cab. Install the hose clamps.
Install new O-rings, lubricate threads of the evaporator core fittings with MINERAL-BASED refrigerant oil and connect the inlet and outlet hoses to evaporator fittings.
If applicable, connect electrical connector(s) to any pressure switches located below the cab floor.
Apply sealant around the Blend-Air unit housing connections where they exit the cab floor ( Figure 14).
Open the heater water valves at the engine; or remove clamps used to close hoses, if used.
Connect electrical wiring. Install the passenger side kick panel if it was removed earlier.
Verify that the control cables are routed into the heater assembly. Connect the control cables to the appropriate points in the Blend-Air unit.
Secure the air ducts in place with sheet metal screws. Be certain the two rubber seals are in place on the duct openings.
Install the floor panel and the floor mat.
Adjust the control cables. Refer to CONTROL CABLE ADJUSTMENT.
Replace coolant lost during heater hose removal. Refer to the Operator's Manual for the correct type of coolant.
Evacuate and charge the air conditioning system as described in GROUP 16-AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual.

note.para: In the following step, to verify correct heater and A/C operation at the air duct outlets, the cover must be in place on the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Run the engine and check the system for leaks (coolant and refrigerant) and proper operation.
Install the Blend-Air unit cover and passenger seat assembly. Tighten the six thumb screws.
